description: This table contains the items for dental finding records.

columns.name: FINDING_ID
columns.description: The unique identifier for the finding record

columns.name: DEN_TOO_FIND_TYPE_C_NAME
columns.description:
Indicates the type of finding, such as caries, fracture, etc.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


PARL


Needs Extraction


Caries


Fracture


Impacted


Monitor


Defective Restoration


Bleeding


Suppuration


Mobility


Furcation


Plaque


Calculus


Retained Root


Missing


Other

columns.name: FINDING_STAT_NOAD_C_NAME
columns.description:
The current status the finding's status (unaddressed, resolved, removed, etc.) of the dental finding


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Addressed


Unaddressed


Resolved


Removed


Auto Resolved


Auto Resolved Untoggled

columns.name: DENTAL_CARIES_CLS_C_NAME
columns.description:
Stores the caries classification of a caries finding


May contain organization-specific values: Yes


 Category Entries: 


I


II


III


IV


V


VI


E1


E2


D1


D2


D3


C1


C2

columns.name: DENTAL_CARIES_DEPTH
columns.description: Stores the caries depth of a caries finding

columns.name: DENTAL_MOBI_CLASS_C_NAME
columns.description:
Stores information about the severity of mobility documented on a tooth.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes


 Category Entries: 


Class I


Class II


Class III

columns.name: DENTAL_FURC_CLASS_C_NAME
columns.description:
Stores information about the severity of furcation documented on a tooth.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes


 Category Entries: 


Class I


Class II


Class III


Class IV

columns.name: DENT_CARIES_INCIP_C_NAME
columns.description:
This columns specifies the incipiency of a caries finding.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes


 Category Entries: 


Not Incipient


Incipient

columns.name: DENT_FND_OVR_NAME
columns.description: This item specifies the display name that will be used when users document a finding. If populated, this will be used in place of the finding type (I RES 17407) to describe the finding.
